abstract: Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, told Charlie Rose that the economy was in a deleveraging process, and that he did not deserve the ire of Occupy Wall Street protesters.
snippet: Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, told Charlie Rose that the economy was in a deleveraging process, and that he did not deserve the ire of Occupy Wall Street protesters.
lead_paragraph: Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, didn't used to do many media appearances. But a series of big magazine profiles that focused on the intense culture of his Connecticut-based hedge fund seem to have eased the billionaire out of his shell.

headline.main: Bridgewater's Dalio: 'I Think I Did Everything Right'
